title: Strategies for Enhancing Science Teachers' Academic Self-Efficacy in Blended Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Basic science education theory and proficiency in mobile device utilization
context.additional_context: A corporate teacher retraining program offering flexible learning environments using mobile devices and LMS (Learning Management Systems).

learning_goals: Learners can explain five core elements (intrinsic motivation, extrinsic motivation, instructor support, performance expectancy, supportive conditions) for measuring academic self-efficacy in blended learning environments.
Through mobile microlearning, learners can design and apply three practical strategies to enhance self-efficacy in science classes.
Using peer feedback and instructor support systems, learners can resolve at least 80% of difficulties encountered in blended learning processes.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
